topic.title: Subscriptions
topic.section:
OMP supports subscription presses by providing a subscription management component and a corresponding password protection for the press's online content. The subscriptions can be managed for individual users, organizations or institutions. A subscription press can also offer free access to its previously published monographs through a form of delayed open access. In Monograph Management, the Editor allows readers free access to the content of a monograph or individual monographs from zero to 24 months after their initial publication and availability to subscribers.

A press's Managers, Editors, Acquisitions Editors, Layout Editors, Copyeditors, and Proofreaders are always free to access the press as though they were subscribers.

Deploying the subscription module. The Press Manager must indicate in Setup, 4.1 Access and Security Settings, that the press will be using this system to manage its subscriptions and that someone, enrolled as a Press Manager or Subscription Manager, has been designated to manage this feature.

Setting up the Subscription Types. The first step in setting up the subscription management is to designate the types of subscriptions the press offers. Presses typically offer, for example, individual subscription and institutional subscription rates. Some presses may have special offers for members of an organization or students. OMP will support the management of print and/or online subscriptions. More than one type of subscription can be created to cover longer periods of time (12 months, 36 months).

Options for Subscription Types. For "institutional" subscriptions, use the "validated via domain or IP authentication" option, as all members of the institution, coming in from its associated domain or IP address, will be permitted access without a password. Similarly, the "members of an association or organization" option should be used for membership subscriptions, whether free to members or at a discount. Use the "publicly visible" option to make the subscription type and its fee appear under Subscriptions on the About the Press. While most subscription types are typically displayed in About, a type created for internal accounting, staff subscriptions, and/or management purposes, for example, would not appear on the About page.

Creating Subscriptions. For individual subscribers, the Press (Subscription) Manager has to register the subscriber as a reader, if not already registered, and then on the Create Subscriptions page, enter the type and dates for the subscription. On saving this information, the subscriber will be emailed a username, which will work with all content the press publishes until the user is deleted from the Subscriptions list by the Press Manager.

Institutional and organizational subscriptions. For institutional subscriptions, the contact person at the institution needs to be enrolled as a reader, and then selected by the Press (Subscription) Manager on the Create Subscriptions page. The contact person will need to provide the institution's domain and/or IP addresses, which are used to validate the account, sparing individual users at the institution the need to have user accounts in order to access subscription content. Organizations with membership lists can have those lists imported into the system, through the Import User function in Press Management.

Under Subscription Policies, the Press Manager can enter Subscription Manager contact information, which will appear in About the Press; enter additional information about subscriptions to appear in About the Press (subscription types and the fee structure will already appear there); set subscription expiry reminders; set open access options; and define an Author self-archiving policy, also to appear in About the Press.
